title: CI/CD Pipeline Setup
description:
Configure CI/CD Pipeline with GitHub Actions

Set up a complete continuous integration and deployment pipeline to automate testing, building, and deployment workflows for the repository.

Requirements:
- Create GitHub Actions workflow file(s) in .github/workflows/
- Configure CI pipeline to run on pull requests and pushes to main branch
- Include automated testing (unit tests, integration tests, linting)
- Set up build process for the application
- Configure deployment to target environment(s) (staging/production)
- Add status badges to README for visibility
- Implement branch protection rules requiring CI checks to pass
- Configure secrets and environment variables securely
- Set up notifications for failed builds
- Define clear deployment triggers (e.g., merge to main deploys to staging, tags deploy to production)
- Include caching strategy to speed up workflow execution
- Document the CI/CD process and how to maintain it

Success Criteria:
- All tests run automatically on every PR
- Deployments occur automatically after successful builds
- Failed builds prevent merging/deployment
- Pipeline completes in reasonable time (< 10 minutes for typical changes)
